trans-unit.source: How to Enable the Content Delivery Network (CDN) for Azure
trans-unit.target: How to Enable the Content Delivery Network (CDN) for Azure

trans-unit.source: This topic shows how to enable the Content Delivery Network (CDN) for Azure.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows how to enable the Content Delivery Network (CDN) for Azure.

trans-unit.source: How to Enable Content Delivery Network (CDN) for Azure
trans-unit.target: How to Enable Content Delivery Network (CDN) for Azure

trans-unit.source: CDN can be enabled for your origin via Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: CDN can be enabled for your origin via Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: The current available origin type includes: Web Apps, storage, Cloud Services.
trans-unit.target: The current available origin type includes: Web Apps, storage, Cloud Services.

trans-unit.source: You can also enable CDN for your Azure Media Services Streaming endpoint.
trans-unit.target: You can also enable CDN for your Azure Media Services Streaming endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Once you enable a CDN endpoint for your origin, all publicly available objects are eligible for CDN edge caching.
trans-unit.target: Once you enable a CDN endpoint for your origin, all publicly available objects are eligible for CDN edge caching.

trans-unit.source: Note that now you can also create a custom origin and it does not have to be Azure.
trans-unit.target: Note that now you can also create a custom origin and it does not have to be Azure.

trans-unit.source: To Create a New CDN Endpoint
trans-unit.target: To Create a New CDN Endpoint

trans-unit.source: Log into the <link><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Log into the <link><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: In the navigation pane, click CDN.
trans-unit.target: In the navigation pane, click CDN.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click New.
trans-unit.target: On the ribbon, click New.

trans-unit.source: In the New dialog, select APP SERVICES, then CDN, then QUICK CREATE.
trans-unit.target: In the New dialog, select APP SERVICES, then CDN, then QUICK CREATE.

trans-unit.source: In the ORIGIN TYPE dropdown, select an origin type form the list of available origin type.
trans-unit.target: In the ORIGIN TYPE dropdown, select an origin type form the list of available origin type.

trans-unit.source: The list of available origin URLs will be displayed in the ORIGIN URL dropdown list.
trans-unit.target: The list of available origin URLs will be displayed in the ORIGIN URL dropdown list.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>createnew</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>createnew</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you select Custom Origin, you can enter a custom origin URL.
trans-unit.target: If you select Custom Origin, you can enter a custom origin URL.

trans-unit.source: That does not have to be an Azure origin.
trans-unit.target: That does not have to be an Azure origin.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>customorigin</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>customorigin</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Currently only HTTP is supported for origin and you must use the Media Services extension to enable Azure CDN for an Azure Media Services streaming endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Currently only HTTP is supported for origin and you must use the Media Services extension to enable Azure CDN for an Azure Media Services streaming endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Click the Create button to create the new endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Click the Create button to create the new endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The configuration created for the endpoint will not immediately be available; it can take up to 60 minutes for the registration to propagate through the CDN network.
trans-unit.target: The configuration created for the endpoint will not immediately be available; it can take up to 60 minutes for the registration to propagate through the CDN network.

trans-unit.source: Users who try to use the CDN domain name immediately may receive status code 400 (Bad Request) until the content is available via the CDN.
trans-unit.target: Users who try to use the CDN domain name immediately may receive status code 400 (Bad Request) until the content is available via the CDN.

trans-unit.source: See Also
trans-unit.target: See Also

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>How to Map Content Delivery Network (CDN) Content to a Custom Domain</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>How to Map Content Delivery Network (CDN) Content to a Custom Domain</linkText><title></title></link>
